marketNews.title: Coord. Minister for Economic Affairs: US Agrees in Principle to Exempt Indonesian Palm Oil, Cocoa, and Rubber From Tariffs
marketNews.content: Minister of Economic Affairs Coordinator, Airlangga Hartarto, told Reuters on Tuesday (8/26) that the US has in principle agreed to exempt or impose near-zero tariffs on Indonesian cocoa, palm oil, and rubber commodities from the 19% tariff imposed by President Donald Trump. Airlangga claimed that the tariff exemption for these three commodities would take effect after both parties reach a final agreement, but no schedule has been set as the US is busy with tariff negotiations with other countries. The US Embassy in Jakarta has not yet responded to Airlangga's claim.

marketNews.title: Thousands of laborers will hold demonstrations on Thursday (8/28) at the DPR RI Building and the Presidential Palace, Jakarta. President of the Labor Party and President of the Indonesian Confederation of Trade Unions, Said Iqbal, stated that laborers demand wage increases and the abolition of outsourcing through this demonstration.
marketNews.content: Thousands of laborers from various regions will hold demonstrations on Thursday (28/8) at the DPR RI Building and the Presidential Palace, Jakarta. President of the Labor Party and President of the Indonesian Confederation of Trade Unions, Said Iqbal, stated that laborers demand wage increases and the abolition of outsourcing through this demonstration.

marketNews.title: LPS Opens Room to Cut Guarantee Interest Rate to the Lowest Level
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS), Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, stated that LPS lowered the maximum guarantee interest rate for Rupiah deposits in conventional banks by 25 bps to 3.75%. Meanwhile, the maximum interest rate for foreign currency deposit guarantees in conventional banks remained at 2.25%. This interest rate will be effective from August 28 to September 30, 2025. This decision follows the trend of decreasing interest rates and efforts to strengthen economic performance, while reaffirming policy synergy.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg: Danantara Signed Master Agreement with GEM Co. Ltd. for HPAL Smelter Development
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Danantara has signed a master agreement worth US$1.42 billion with GEM Co. Ltd. to develop an HPAL smelter with a production capacity of 66,000 tons of MHP nickel per year. Both parties will jointly invest in the project, which is expected to involve collaboration with Vale Indonesia (INCO) and other partners.

marketNews.title: EnQuest Announces PSC Execution for Gaea and Gaea II Exploration Blocks
marketNews.content: The British oil and gas company, EnQuest, announced that it, together with its joint venture partners and the Indonesian government, has signed production sharing contracts for the Gaea and Gaea II exploration blocks in West Papua. EnQuest holds a 40% participation right in both blocks. This agreement marks EnQuest's entry into Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Real Stories, Successful Investment Starting with Capital from IDR 10 Million
marketNews.content: "Investment success is not determined by the size of the capital, but by discipline, patience, and consistency." - husin1030

tickerNews.title: EXCL 2Q25: Net Loss of IDR 1.6 T, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera (EXCL) recorded a net loss of 1.6 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: profit 385 billion rupiah, 2Q24: profit 484 billion rupiah). This result caused EXCL's net loss for 1H25 to reach 1.2 trillion rupiah (vs. 1H24: profit 1 trillion rupiah), below the 2025F consensus expectation which projected a net profit of 1.5 trillion rupiah. Here are some of our important notes: Number of Subscribers Increased to 82.6 Million Operationally, EXCL recorded 82.6 million mobile subscribers in 2Q25 (+41% YoY, +40% QoQ), below the initial estimate of the subscriber base at the level of 94.5 million. EXCL management explained that the lower subscriber base compared to estimates was due to the harmonization of subscriber definitions post-merger. The mobile average revenue per user (ARPU) decreased to 36 thousand rupiah in 2Q25 (-14% YoY, -5% QoQ) due to the lower ARPU of Smartfren subscribers (2024: 24 thousand rupiah) compared to XL Axiata (2024: 43 thousand rupiah). Increased Costs Across All Post-Merger Expenses The quarterly net loss in 2Q25 was caused by an increase in all expenses being more aggressive than revenue growth. The main expense increase came from salary and employee expenses reaching 1.1 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+139% YoY, +114% QoQ) due to increased headcount, and infrastructure expenses of 3 trillion rupiah (+39% YoY, +29% QoQ) due to an increase in the number of sites and regulatory costs from additional spectrum obtained post-merger. All these expenses pushed EXCL's after-tax loss to 1.6 trillion rupiah in 2Q25. Nevertheless, EXCL reported that the company still recorded a normalized profit after tax of 313 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-36% YoY, -19% QoQ) if one ignores one-off expenses such as integration costs (379 billion rupiah), accelerated depreciation costs (739 billion rupiah), and asset impairment (802 billion rupiah). The asset impairment recorded in 2Q25 originated from assets held for the 900 MHz frequency, which EXCL is obligated to return at the end of 2026. 2025 Guidance: EBITDA Margin Around 40-45% Following the post-merger release, EXCL management announced initial guidance for 2025, targeting revenue growth of +20-30% YoY (vs. 1H25: +12% YoY) and an EBITDA margin of 40-45% (vs. 1H25: 46%). EXCL management also anticipates additional integration costs of 1 trillion rupiah in 2H25 and expects a reduction in opex costs of around 100-200 million US dollars or equivalent to 1.6-3.2 trillion rupiah this year. Key Takeaway Following this financial performance release, EXCL shares fell -6.8% to 2,760 rupiah per share on Wednesday (27/8). We assess that the market reacted negatively due to integration cost realization being greater than market expectations. Going forward, EXCL's performance until the end of 2025 will still be challenging due to several factors: 1) projected additional integration costs of up to 1 trillion rupiah during 2H25; and 2) accelerated depreciation costs will also continue because they relate to 900MHz equipment and assets from legacy vendors. This is also reflected in the EBITDA margin which is still expected to decrease from 46% in 2Q25 to the range of 40-45% throughout 2025, partly due to FREN's lower EBITDA margin.

tickerNews.title: MDKA Subsidiary Pani Gold Project Reportedly Plans IPO
tickerNews.content: Kontan reports that Merdeka Copper Gold's subsidiary managing the Pani gold project has registered for an IPO with the OJK (Financial Services Authority). Kontan stated that this IPO will be held in September 2025, with Trimegah Sekuritas Indonesia (TRIM) and Indo Premier Sekuritas as underwriters. Indo Premier told Kontan that they had no information to convey, while TRIM has not yet responded.

tickerNews.title: BREN: Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd. Share Sale Reduces Stake
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy shareholder, Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd., sold 2 billion BREN shares, based on KSEI data as of August 22, 2025. The transaction value is unknown. Following this transaction, Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd.'s ownership in BREN decreased from 23.6% to 22.1%. Previously, Green Era Pte. Ltd. sold 8.3 million BREN shares at an average price of 9,126 rupiah per share on August 11-13, 2025, to increase the stock's free float.

tickerNews.title: PGAS 7M25 Performance: Gas Sales Volume Below Target, Transmission Volume Above Target
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara recorded gas sales volume of 834 BBtud during 7M25 (-2% YoY), which is lower by about 4-13% from the 2025 target in the range of 873-958 BBtud. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,638 MMSCFD during 7M25 (+10% YoY), which is +14% higher than the 2025 target of 1,435 MMSCFD. The upstream sales volume reached 16,519 BOEPD during 7M25 (-20% YoY), which is -4% lower than the 2025 target of 17,227 BOEPD.

tickerNews.title: MITI: Subsidiary Obtains Silica Sand Mining Exploration Permits in Ketapang, West Kalimantan
tickerNews.content: Mitra Investindo through its business entities, PT Danau Buntar Kuarsa and PT Kendawangan Prima Silika, has obtained exploration mining business permits (IUP) for silica sand mining. The exploration IUP for PT Danau Buntar Kuarsa covers a working area of 4,888 ha, while the concession area for the exploration IUP of PT Kendawangan Prima Silika is 2,965 ha. Both IUP areas are located in Ketapang Regency, West Kalimantan, and are adjacent to the IUP location of another MITI entity - namely, PT Kendawangan Berkah Kersik - which obtained an exploration IUP at the end of January 2025.

tickerNews.title: DSSA Subsidiary Forms Joint Venture for Geothermal Development
tickerNews.content: Dian Swastatika Sentosa through its subsidiary, PT DSSR Daya Mas Sakti, established a joint venture with PT FirstGen Geothermal Indonesia, a subsidiary of Energy Development Corporation which is part of First Gen Corporation. This joint venture will focus on the development and management of geothermal resources with a combined potential capacity of approximately 440 MW across 6 fields located in West Java, Flores, Jambi, West Sumatra, and Central Sulawesi. Energy Development Corporation itself is a new and renewable energy producer from the Philippines.

tickerNews.title: KRYA Shareholders Approve New President Director and Acquisition by Green City SG Pte. Ltd.
tickerNews.content: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya shareholders on Tuesday (26/8) approved the appointment of William Teng as the company's new president director, replacing Dharmo Budiono. William Teng currently serves as CEO of PT Green City Traffic (ECGO) and director of Green City SG Pte. Ltd. Meanwhile, Green City SG Pte. Ltd. purchased 41% of KRYA shares at a price of 33 rupiah per share on August 25, 2025. This transaction is part of the acquisition of a new controlling shareholder, as previously announced by the company in July 2025.

tickerNews.title: ARCI Appoints Macmahon Indonesia as Mining Services Contractor for Kopra Underground Mine Project
tickerNews.content: Archi Indonesia (ARCI) through its subsidiary, PT Tambang Tondano Nusajaya, appointed PT Macmahon Indonesia as the mining services contractor for the Kopra underground mine project. This cooperation lasts for 34 months with an unstated transaction value.
